N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 451.112 - Fixed asset

State Regulations
(a) A tangible
asset held for the services it yields in the production of goods and services; any item of plant. (b) A balance
sheet classification denoting capital assets other than intangibles and
investments in affiliated companies or other long-term investments. Included in
the usual fixed-asset categories are land (from which the flow of services is
seemingly permanent), buildings, building equipment, fixtures, machinery, tools
(large and small), furniture, office devices, patterns, drawings, dies, and
often containers; generally excluded are goodwill, patents and other
intangibles. The characteristic fixed asset has a limited life (land is the one
important exception), and, in organizations where expenses are accounted for, its cost, less estimated salvage at the end of its useful life, is distributed
over the periods it benefits by means of provisions of depreciation. Notes
